inn1.comm: full a couple of feet wide of off stump, left alone
touch wider and left easily again
much tighter line, Thirimanne forward on off stump and plays with the gentle swing into the leg side
this is the one that slides across the left-hander, able to leave it alone again
another away-swinger and I reckon the batsman was beaten there, slightly feeling for it around the off stump
fuller and swinging in, Thirimanne is late coming forward but keeps it out, maiden to start
good length on off stump, well forward and playing into the covers
touch fuller and driven past backward point, not an entirely controlled stroke but gets two as third man runs around to his right
inswinger, strikes the pad but would have slid down leg
fuller delivery, driven off low on the bat back to the bowler
drifts to leg and this takes the thigh pad to long leg
firm punch off the back foot to cover point
full and swinging away from Dilshan who sensibly leave alone
in-ducker this time, takes the thigh pad to point
similar delivery, this time ricochets to midwicket
good length, Dilshan from the crease steers it out to backward point
a little short, cut hard but straight to point, Anderson gets away with one
fuller and wider, Dilshan sort of chases it, then pulls out of the stroke but still played under it but it's called wide, certainly borderline

but the bonus ball works! Anderson produces a gorgeous nip-backer that takes the inside edge to Buttler who holds a solid catch going to his left. Dilshan stuck in the crease, poked forward, the seam movement took his inside edge and he walked off, a third early strike in three matches for Anderson
back of a length around off stump, blocked into the covers
touch wider line, pushed at firmly slightly away from the body and steers it down to third man, albeit in the air
fuller length and clipped wide of mid-on for a quick single, well ran
too short and wide and cut for four, poor ball, nicely played
too straight and full now and clipped through midwicket for an easy couple
back on the mark now with a full length ball just outside off which is left alone
just back of a length on the off stump, waited for and watches the swing very carefully before playing out into the gap at cover for a quick single
short at the throat but well played, nicely dabbed down to square leg
full on off stump, driven off the outer half of the bat to mid-off
tighter line and just blocked around middle and off

well, a step down the wicket, Anderson sees him coming and drops his length, Thirimanne goes through with the stroke aiming over cover but just nicks it to Buttler. Not the best choice of stroke it must be said. Came down the track too soon really and then didn't have the nous to pull out of the stroke. A little unlucky not to get more bat on that and send it over the slips but, you make your own luck!
outside edge first ball but it lands short of second slip, a little feel outside off but Jayawardene managed to get on top of it and steer it down but it was still an edge and lucky it didn't carry
full and wide of off stump, a wild cover drive and misses
this is what he was after the previous ball, a gorgeous check drive, opening the face to steer it past extra cover, lovely timing
much tighter line and this is just blocked around off stump
nice angle into the left-hander who was unsure outside off and got beaten
slightly narrower line and blocked from the crease in front of off stump
wide enough to leave alone outside off this time
little in-ducker, strikes the thigh pad
more confident press forward and block on off stump
shorter but well ridden and knocked down towards point

fuller and dabbed into the leg side, Mahela says yes then no and there's a big chance for a run out, Anderson on his knees throws at the bowler's end stumps and misses! Bad miss really, all three to aim at, would have been Jayawardene gone, huge mix up
full on the off stump, pressed carefully to mid-off
tighter line and this is ran back up to the bowler
lovely delivery, sliding across Jayawardene and beats him outside off stump, did him on the angle
much tighter line and tucked down to long leg
full, angled in and blocked in the crease
similar delivery, waited for a little more and defended
similar area and just knocked into the covers once more
another good line and length, that's a very tidy over
back of a length and ignored outside off
angled into the right-hander, played very late in the crease and knocked into square leg for a quick single
full at the stumps, driven off a thick inside edge into midwicket and they get another run
full at the off stump, blocked in the crease back to the bowler
even fuller and this time driven back to the bowler, not too much swing out there
touch wider line and felt for, ran it to cover
back of a length and angled towards point
fuller and wider and left alone
full on middle and leg, clipped out to long leg
full and leg side comfortably
back of a length, blocked in the crease in the direction of point
gets the line right again and this is dabbed down on the off side
fuller, played firmly to mid-off, steady first over from Jordan
full length just outside off, tries to run it down towards third man but only finds backward point
shorter and Jayawardene is jumping back in his crease to knock this down on the leg side
full around off stump, played exceptionally late but kept out
comes forward this time and defends towards cover
back of a length, Jayawardene tries to uppercut but misses, dangerous with two slips in place, no need for that stroke really
full just outside off, forward and knocked into the cover
poor ball, short and wide and effortlessly cut over backward point

full length angled across the off stump, a big drive and this time it's edged to the keeper. That's the length that's needed in these conditions and Jordan has found it there, luring Sangakkara out to cover drive a little too loosely and he nicks off, thick edge to Buttler's left at waist height
good length but wide of off stump and left alone
fuller and at the stumps, blocked in the crease
shorter, played off the back foot and ran towards point
much fuller at the stumps, driven back to the bowler who fields
full length at the stumps, tucked to square leg
played as late as possible again, ran to midwicket from a full length
full length at the stumps, blocked up the wicket
much shorter and a careful pull steers a single down to long leg
good length on off stump, blocked in the crease
left on length, strikes the pad, too high for the appeal
full length two feet wide of off stump and left alone
step across the stumps and gets a ball angled in off the thigh pad to long leg
straight line and tucked past short leg for a quick single
bumper, ducked and it's called wide on height
full at the pads, clipped through midwicket for an easy couple
full length at the stumps, blocked around middle and off from the crease
angled in, Chandimal misses aiming to play to leg and gets struck on the pad
good length around off stump, played late with an open face and ran down to third man
firm drive from the stumps out to mid-off
full at the stumps, firmly played back past the bowler and they take a quick single inside mid-off
forward and dropped into the leg side, sharp single inside midwicket
short and helped down to long leg, gentle connection on the pull
played from the crease, tucked into midwicket and they off for a sharp single
angled in and well left, that wasn't too far away from off stump
tighter line and worked down to long leg
full length a foot wide of off stump, firmly driven to mid-off

full and wide and Chandimal leans out greedily to drive at it and slaps it to cover where Ian Bell takes a sharp low catch, well held that. Chandimal was perhaps frustrated by the dots and took the chance to swing his arms, he struck it very firmly but straight to the fielder
bumper first up to Mathews who ducks
full at the stumps, dropped into midwicket
played late around off stump, knocked into the covers
shorter length, strikes the thigh pad but Jayawardene looking to play to leg
back of a length around leg stump, dropped down behind square leg and they take a quick single, productive area that for Jayawardene
full angled across the right-hander who leaves alone
off stump line and blocked in the crease

some width offered outside off and it's firmly played past extra cover, nice stroke and decent timing but it won't reach the rope because the outfield it pretty slow and Cook pulls it in a foot from the boundary
bumper and ducked
full length and again a touch of width gives Mathews the chance to free his arms and he drives past mid-off, no foot movement but a good connection
back of a length and takes the hip to a flying Buttler down the leg side
full and blocked around off stump back to the bowler
bumper down the leg side
good length at middle and off, tucked back up the wicket
more width and another boundary, uppish again and finds the gap wide of point, more decent timing from Mathews, bravely going for his strokes here

on line first up, Jayawardene plays around the delivery... and he's gone! Tredwell removes the last of Sri Lanka's senior triumvirate with his first ball, Jayawardene got himself in a bit of a muddle and was stuck heavy-footed in front of off stump, missed the ball trying to work across the line
bit of grip for Tredwell, played into the off side
full and floated up outside off, pushes into the covers
pushed back down the track on the front foot
pushed through on the stumps, Priyanjan plays defensively forward
goes back and slides a single off the face of the bat to short third man
slightly back of a length over the top of off stump, Priynjan gets in line to defend
pushed into the leg side from the crease, they scamper through for one

pitched up and Mathews is beaten on the drive, the umpire gives it... but, after a few moments of quizzical blinking, Mathews calls for the review. There was a thin sound on the replay, England all went up in unison; can't see what else it would have been, as Mathews was playing away from his body, bat above the ground as the ball went past... And Real-Time Snicko has picked up a sliver of audio, so the decision is upheld and Sri Lanka's captain trudges off
back of a length over the stumps, Kula gets in line and defends from the crease
dug in again, Kulasekara rides it well and dabs round the corner, they think about one but quickly recant the idea
on the stumps, tight line from Jordan, worked to leg and a misfield means they get a single
tossed up, Kulasekara leans out and defends
pushed through, flat trajectory, gets outside off and pushed back to the bowler
tossed up around the line of off, worked around the front pad to short midwicket
flighted, tries to get forward but forced into another defensive tap
nudges this behind square on the leg side for a single
Priyanjan uses his feet, the ball dips and gets a bit of purchase, beats the bat on the inside and hit the body
Jordan bangs this in short and Kulasekara stays tight down in his box, lets it fly overhead
straight line, flicks a length ball past the two close fielders and gets a couple through backward square
slightly short and over the stumps, nudged off the hips behind square for one more

nudged short on the leg side, they try to steal one but Bopara's direct hit means Priyanjan is gone! It was tight, the batsman could maybe have thrown himself for the line with a bit more vigour, but Bopara's throw was a peach, he was moving from mid-on and had to swivel around to his left to hit one-and-a-half stumps
goes shortish and outside off, sways out of the way
back of a length, Kulasekara jabs at it and steers to second slip, Sri Lanka are eight down! England ripping through, that's four for Jordan, too quick and a bit of extra venom from a shortish ball

tossed up, Senanayake goes after his first ball and clumps this down the ground, only for long-on to take a excellent running catch! Chris Woakes was the fielder, did really well to hang on, Senanayake didn't get quite enough of it and SL have lost three for none in four balls!
around the wicket, tossed up and straightening on middle and leg, comes of bat and pad but short of the catcher
pushed through a little flatter outside off, steered square on the off side
gets on the front foot and plays back defensiely
comes forward and blocks
tossed up and played back to the bowler
back of a length outside the line of off, Malinga sways out of the way
stays back and drops the hands again as Jordan continues in the channel outside off
jerkily dabs the ball down on to the leg side, short leg is in attendance
fuller, outside off, leans forward and manages to punch a couple through the covers
slams this in very short, smell of burnt leather for Malinga as it whistles through

pitched up, this stays a little low and clips Malinga on the back pad, in front of leg stump and that's good enough for Michael Gough, who raises the finger and drops the curtain on the Sri Lanka innings! Jordan gets his five-for, the first by an England bowler at Old Trafford

inn2.comm: length delivery from over the wicket, Cook shuffles across and defends
slides down the leg side, Cook flicks off his hips and misses, Sanga prevents any further damage
a touch short and Cook mechanically swings the arms through a clunky cut past point
outside off and left alone this time
stays back, this shapes away a little off the pitch, Cook jabs at it defensively
Cook goes back and across and pushes defensively towards mid-off
better from Kulasekara, enticing Cook forward outside off and he only just manages to hold his bat inside the line
slingy, length delivery around off, Bell stays back and blocks
goes back again, opens the face and runs the ball to backward point
fuller length, skips forward to meet this on the drive outside off, crisply struck but mid-off make a tumbling stop
skids through on a length outside off, left alone
straighter line, all pace so far from Malinga, Bell blocks from the crease
overpitched and this is wide enough to catch Bell's interest, he smites a beautifully timed square drive past cover point for the first boundary of the innings
sits back and taps a length ball towards mid-on
slightly full and straight and Cook clips three off his legs in front of square, nearly a misfield on the rope but the boundary is prevented
Bell makes an early move forward, Kula drags his line wide... too wide
pitched up around off, presses forward and an inside edge runs behind square on the leg side
full and leg-stump-ish from Kula, shovelled square off the pads and this is timed well enough to beat the fielder running round from fine leg
an edge... but it drops short, Thirimanne actually did well to stop it at second slip. Cook beaten by a little away movement but played it reasonably well
better line from Kulasekara, snaking towards off stump, Cook props forward to block
dug in short by Malinga, only around 80mph though and Bell happily paddles it round the corner for a couple
now the slower yorker, dipping on leg stump, Bell watches it all the way on the bat and glances fine
full and fast this time, Cook drops the bat on it comfortably enough
another slower delivery, wide of the stumps, Cook reaches out to shake hands with it, the ball bounces to mid-off
rolls the fingers over it again, comes out as a low full toss and Cook plays a straight drive out of the middle, picks out mid-off
gets forward and bunts a single back past the bowler
pitched up on the pads and Cook takes another business-like brace through square
in the channel, chopped into the off side
little bit of width, Cook swings through a cut stroke, finds the man at backward point
slightly full length, Cook gets forward and pushes on the up into the covers
goes back and defends in front of the stumps
good length, on middle and leg, Cook whips it to the man at midwicket
Malinga pitches this up around off, pushed back to the on side
shorter length, goes back and across and defends
Bell leans out to drive, takes an inside chunk of the bat and rebounds on to the pads
bumper from Malinga, tennis-ball bounce outside off and Bell swivel-swats it through midwicket, they push for a third, despite Cook's tender area
Cook picks out square leg on the pull but it's dropped, into the hands and out as Senanayake plunged forward! Should have been taken
back of a length and Bell whips a pull through square, he wants a second and is halfway down the pitch before he registers Cook's gruff "No!"
tossed up outside off, Bell plays forward and gets a thickish edge low past slip for a couple
plays this gently back to the bowler
flighted, outside the line of off, firmly driven towards extra cover and a sprawling stop can't prevent one
goes over the wicket now, skidding on, Cook punches back down the track
fuller, around middle and off, swept in the air but bounces well short of fine leg
back around the wicket to the right-handed Bell, who cuts in front of square
Bell skips forward but Senanayake spots him and drags his length down, almost yorks himself but keeps the ball out
uses the feet again, this time Senanayake tosses it wider, Bell squirts a drive through the covers, not quite all the way
around the wicket to Cook, flicks a couple to leg

skids on and Cook misses playing across the line, Gough turns down the appeal for leg-before but Mathews wants a review... He was quite a long way back but the ball didn't really straighten, it was the wobble-seam carrom ball out of the front of the hand - and Hawk-Eye has it just clipping the top of leg but not enough to overturn the on-field call
touch short and wide, Cook rattles the wrists through a cut behind square, holds up in the outfield but they get three
flatter trajectory outside off, to counter Bell coming forwards, chopped towards point
pushed through outside off, Cook drops back and slaps a couple through point
straighter line and worked off the legs for one more
Bell drops back as Herath gives this some air, plays a delightful late cut and the ball skips away through backward point for another boundary
tighter line on off stump, pushed back down the track
comes forward, drives and gets an inside edge, the ball going on with the arm
full and flighted, Cook reaches out and turns to leg - less than 20 required now
around the wicket, orthodox offspin, tapped back on the off side
goes across his stumps and flicks a single behind square
continues around the wicket, touch short and glanced off the hips through square
length ball on the stumps, no turn and milked for a couple down to long leg
on the stumps and tapped back defensively
floats this one up towards the blockhole, driven back, might have come off the boot, Priyanjan fields
Herath around the wicket, straightening outside off, played back to the bowler
lovely stroke from Bell, pushes forward into a super-sexy on-drive and this races away for four
tossed up on the stumps and poked back watchfully
oooh, that warms the cockles, a late cut now, forward and then back to dab the ball away from in front of off stump - the requirement single figures now
on the stumps, nurdles one to leg
good delivery from Herath, over the wicket and the arm ball skids past the outside edge with Cook half forward
tossed up and played back to the bowler
reaches out with a horizontal bat and paddles one behind square
on the stumps, Cook plays it with a straight bat
bit of width, attempted cut but it comes off a bottom edge

full and Cook leans out to steer a drive wide of mid-on, where Malinga gives a token effort at stopping the ball low to his left - don't think he fancied muddying his knees for that - and the scores are level
touch short, tries to chop the ball away, doesn't connect properly

Bell wins it with a six, launches the ball down the ground and punches the air - England win by 10 wickets! They've exorcised the ghost of Lumley Castle, stuck a flake in their 99 and strolled to a 2-1 series lead in between the Manchester showers
